topLevelComment.author: Androgynous blob
topLevelComment.text: 41:03 i know im a year late but right when i try and run it it says "Member 'GameObject.FindGameObjectsWithTag(string)' cannot be accessed with an instance reference; qualify it with a type name instead" i tried removing the quotation marks but then it says "The name 'SideBounds' does not exist in the current context" Ive proofread everything multiple times and everything is spelled and written correctly, does anyone know how to fix this?

replies.author: Justin Anderson
replies.text:
make sure FindGameObjectsWithTag("sideBounds"); matches the name exactly in the hierarchy.
make sure SideBounds = GameObject is the same SideBounds as your private GameObject

SideBounds = GameObject.FindGameObjectsWtihTag("sideBounds");
^private GameObject ------------------------------------------------------ ^Unity Hierarchy name

topLevelComment.author: Necronomikyle
topLevelComment.text:
Good video so far, I'm just over an hour in. Also I really enjoyed your udemy course. But at 1:16:24 how are you renaming the animation name? I've tried double clicking the text, right clicking and looking for a rename option, and the title in the inspector and can't seem to change any of them.
Most of my googling led to a lot of "you can't responses," but obviously it is possible.

Any idea what I might be doing wrong, or has anybody had this issue?

replies.author: Máté Kovács
replies.text:
Nope. It should have rename option. Make sure that what you want to rename is actually selected (blue or grey bar), then right click it.

Also, there is a possibility that it's just Unity being a b*tch. Happens sometimes, like when you try to make a script with space in it, but it doesn't allow to drag & drop it anywhere.
